queries.description: Unsigned integer expressions do not strictly overflow, but instead wrap around in a modular way. If the size of the type is not sufficient, this can happen unexpectedly.
queries.name: Ensure that unsigned integer operations do not wrap

INT30-C.title: Ensure that unsigned integer operations do not wrap

queries.description: Converting an integer value to another integer type with a different sign or size can lead to data loss or misinterpretation of the value.
queries.name: Ensure that integer conversions do not result in lost or misinterpreted data

INT31-C.title: Ensure that integer conversions do not result in lost or misinterpreted data

queries.description: The multiplication of two signed integers can lead to underflow or overflow and therefore undefined behavior.
queries.name: Ensure that operations on signed integers do not result in overflow

INT32-C.title: Ensure that operations on signed integers do not result in overflow

queries.description: Dividing or taking the remainder by zero is undefined behavior.
queries.name: Ensure that division and remainder operations do not result in divide-by-zero errors

INT33-C.title: Ensure that division and remainder operations do not result in divide-by-zero errors

queries.description: The precision of integer types in C cannot be deduced from the size of the type (due to padding and sign bits) otherwise a loss of data may occur.
queries.name: Use correct integer precisions

queries.description: Unsigned integer expressions do not strictly overflow, but instead wrap around in a modular way. Any constant unsigned integer expressions that in effect "overflow" will not be detected by the compiler. Although there may be good reasons at run-time to rely on the modular arithmetic provided by unsigned integer types, the reasons for using it at compile-time to evaluate a constant expression are less obvious. Any instance of an unsigned integer constant expression wrapping around is therefore likely to indicate a programming error.
queries.name: Evaluation of constant expressions should not lead to unsigned integer wrap-around

RULE-12-4.title: Evaluation of constant expressions should not lead to unsigned integer wrap-around
